definition: to fall down
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Suddenly he bowed over, however, and was rushed from the room.
sentences.chinese: 可是突然间，他扑倒在地，被人急速送出了会议室。

sentences.english: When I shot it, hundreds of small people fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 当我开枪时，有数百位小人扑倒在地上。

sentences.english: The sad boy flung himself down on his bed and cried loudly.
sentences.chinese: 伤心的男孩扑倒在床上，大声哭起来。

sentences.english: Alarm, the guards down to the ground, again and again a misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 惊恐之下，卫兵扑倒在地，连连请罪。

sentences.english: He hawked on me down and clutched my throat with his two hands.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地把我扑倒在地，用双手掐住我的喉咙。

sentences.english: The old beggar threw himself at the Caliph's feet.
sentences.chinese: 老乞丐扑倒在哈里发的脚下。

sentences.english: The policeman brought the thief to the ground with a flying tackle.
sentences.chinese: 警察飞身上前把盗贼扑倒在地上。

sentences.english: So tired she just belly-flopped on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 太累了，她即扑倒在床上。

sentences.english: The impact smacks the man into the steering wheel.
sentences.chinese: 冲力使他扑倒在方向盘上。

sentences.english: With a wail the Queen cast herself down and began to weep and to beat her hands on the stones.
sentences.chinese: 女王哀号着扑倒在地，敲打着石地板痛哭起来。

sentences.english: A single cat finds it tricky to bring down a full-grown wildebeest.
sentences.chinese: 一只豹子会发现自己很难扑倒一只成年角马。

sentences.english: There was clearly nothing left to do but drop herself onto the shabby little couch and weep. (SB2, )
sentences.chinese: 很显然，她只好扑倒在那破旧的长沙发上哭泣。

sentences.english: Read YCN everyday, A Monkey can push over a cute soldier easily.
sentences.chinese: 只要按时阅读YCN，猴子都能轻易扑倒可爱女兵。

sentences.english: He put his hand round his neck, made a strange sound, and fell face down on to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他一只手卡住自己的脖子，怪叫一声，扑倒在地。

sentences.english: They run them down and make their kill with a bite to the jugular.
sentences.chinese: 它们会扑倒猎物并咬住咽喉杀死猎物。

sentences.english: He loosened himself all over and fell in the fire across the frying pan of hot water for washing the dishes.
sentences.chinese: 他立刻全身瘫软，扑倒在正烧着洗碗水的煎锅里。

definition: to take a fall
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to push over/to overthrow
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to fall to the ground
to kick/to trample/to tread on
to knock down/to mow down
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
limp/weak
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
to scream/blood-curdling screech/miserable shriek
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
local
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
